::Enertron::
    His body had been repairing itself and was now finished.  Even his arm 
had been repaired although it still lay detached on the ground.  He had 
considered reinstalling it but left it off as a reminder of his failings.  He 
had spent his time wisely, however.  He spent most of the sitting and 
reviewing the previous battle.  He now knew that he needed to dodge and move 
faster.  To do this he trimmed his wings.  It was excruciatingly painful but 
he was now more aerodynamic.  He also needed better aim.  This was easier 
once his wings were recovering but of a new shape.  He began flying at high 
speeds and shooting hapless birds.  Once he was able to hit a bird at any 
speed he sat and waited.

    He was sitting on his island home when he saw the "dark light."  It took 
a minute to register what it was but he quickly realized that his battle was 
not yet over.  He picked up his arm and grimaced as he jammed it back in its 
socket and reattached its circuitry and motor controls.  It still hurt but 
that would be a fitting reminder.  He would need both arms for the battle to 
come.  He took off and headed toward the source of the light.  By the time he 
arrived Galvatron had already left and Enertron had no way to track him so he 
sat.
